Advanced vascular treatments

Say goodbye to varicose veins permanently

Jennifer found herself increasingly reluctant to wear skirts or dresses due to the varicose veins that had developed on her legs. "I felt limited in my wardrobe choices, and the discomfort was getting worse," she shared during her first consultation. Like her, many people seek an effective solution for varicose and spider veins. Today, thanks to our advanced sclerotherapy and vascular laser treatments, Jennifer and hundreds of patients have regained confidence in their legs.

Advanced vascular technology

Two effective solutions for your veins

Specialized treatments

Microfoam sclerotherapy

An effective treatment that:

  • Uses specialized microfoam medication
  • Collapses affected vessel walls
  • Eliminates blood flow in damaged veins
  • Reduces visible varicose and spider veins

State-of-the-art vascular laser

Advanced technology that:

  • Eliminates spider veins without damaging skin
  • Immediately coagulates affected vessels
  • Requires only 3-5 sessions for optimal results
  • Offers long-lasting, natural results

Your treatment experience

Sarah, a 52-year-old teacher, had been looking for a solution to her leg veins for some time. "I had tried creams and compression stockings but needed something more effective," she shared. Today, after completing her sclerotherapy treatment, she enjoys vein-free legs.

The treatment process

Our vein treatment includes:

  • Microfoam injection with ultra-fine needles
  • Spaced sessions for optimal results
  • Gradual vein elimination
  • Post-treatment follow-up
  • Home care recommendations

Frequently asked questions about vein treatment

No. Sclerotherapy is performed with very fine needles, and vascular laser comes with a cooling system for your comfort. Most patients describe only slight discomfort.

The number of sessions varies according to your particular case. Generally, between 3 and 5 sessions are recommended for optimal results.

Most patients notice visible improvements after the first session. Complete results develop gradually over the following weeks.

Yes. Both sclerotherapy and vascular laser are internationally approved, safe procedures. We perform a complete evaluation beforehand to ensure the treatment is right for you.

The science behind the treatment

The microfoam used in sclerotherapy contains a mixture of soluble physiological gases and polidocanol, a highly effective substance that:

  • Collapses affected vessel walls
  • Promotes natural vein absorption
  • Improves blood circulation
  • Reduces new vein formation
